Utah Code Annotated - Title 41 - Motor Vehicles
===============================================

Utah Code Annotated - Title 41 - Chapter 1a - Motor Vehicle Act
***************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Motor Vehicle Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(1): "Actual miles" means the actual distance a vehicle has traveled while in operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(2): "Actual weight" means the actual unladen weight of a vehicle or combination of vehicles as operated and certified to by a weighmaster.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(3): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type I vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(4): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type II vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(5): 41-22-2 "All-terrain type III vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6): "Alternative fuel vehicle" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(a): an electric motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(b): a hybrid electric motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(c): a plug-in hybrid electric motor vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(d): a motor vehicle powered exclusively by a fuel other than:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(d)(i): motor fuel;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(d)(ii): diesel fuel;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(d)(iii): natural gas; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(6)(d)(iv): propane.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(7): "Amateur radio operator" means a person licensed by the Federal Communications Commission to engage in private and experimental two-way radio operation on the amateur band radio frequencies.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(8): 53-3-102 "Autocycle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(9): 41-26-102.1 "Automated driving system" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(10): "Branded title" means a title certificate that is labeled:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(10)(a): rebuilt and restored to operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(10)(b): flooded and restored to operation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(10)(c): not restored to operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(11): "Camper" means a structure designed, used, and maintained primarily to be mounted on or affixed to a motor vehicle that contains a floor and is designed to provide a mobile dwelling, sleeping place, commercial space, or facilities for human habitation or for camping.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(12): "Certificate of title" means a document issued by a jurisdiction to establish a record of ownership between an identified owner and the described vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(13): "Certified scale weigh ticket" means a weigh ticket that has been issued by a weighmaster.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(14): "Commercial vehicle" means a motor vehicle, trailer, or semitrailer used or maintained for the transportation of persons or property that operates:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(14)(a): as a carrier for hire, compensation, or profit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(14)(b): as a carrier to transport the vehicle owner's goods or property in furtherance of the owner's commercial enterprise.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(15): "Commission" means the State Tax Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(16): 59-13-102 "Consumer price index" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(17): "Dealer" means a person engaged or licensed to engage in the business of buying, selling, or exchanging new or used vehicles, vessels, or outboard motors either outright or on conditional sale, bailment, lease, chattel mortgage, or otherwise or who has an established place of business for the sale, lease, trade, or display of vehicles, vessels, or outboard motors.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(18): 59-13-102 "Diesel fuel" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(19): 41-1a-106 "Division" means the Motor Vehicle Division of the commission, created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(20): 41-26-102.1 "Dynamic driving task" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(21): "Electric motor vehicle" means a motor vehicle that is powered solely by an electric motor drawing current from a rechargeable energy storage system.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(22): "Essential parts" means the integral and body parts of a vehicle of a type required to be registered in this state, the removal, alteration, or substitution of which would tend to conceal the identity of the vehicle or substantially alter the vehicle's appearance, model, type, or mode of operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(23): "Farm tractor" means a motor vehicle designed and used primarily as a farm implement for drawing plows, mowing machines, and other implements of husbandry.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(24): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(24)(a): "Farm truck" means a truck used by the owner or operator of a farm solely for the owner's or operator's own use in the transportation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(24)(a)(i): farm products, including livestock and its products, poultry and its products, floricultural and horticultural products;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(24)(a)(ii): farm supplies, including tile, fence, and any other thing or commodity used in agricultural, floricultural, horticultural, livestock, and poultry production; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(24)(a)(iii): livestock, poultry, and other animals and things used for breeding, feeding, or other purposes connected with the operation of a farm.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(24)(b): "Farm truck" does not include the operation of trucks by commercial processors of agricultural products.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(25): "Fleet" means one or more commercial vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(26): "Foreign vehicle" means a vehicle of a type required to be registered, brought into this state from another state, territory, or country other than in the ordinary course of business by or through a manufacturer or dealer, and not registered in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(27): "Gross laden weight" means the actual weight of a vehicle or combination of vehicles, equipped for operation, to which shall be added the maximum load to be carried.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(28): "Highway" or "street" means the entire width between property lines of every way or place of whatever nature when any part of it is open to the public, as a matter of right, for purposes of vehicular traffic.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(29): "Hybrid electric motor vehicle" means a motor vehicle that draws propulsion energy from onboard sources of stored energy that are both:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(29)(a): an internal combustion engine or heat engine using consumable fuel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(29)(b): a rechargeable energy storage system where energy for the storage system comes solely from sources onboard the vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(30): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(30)(a): "Identification number" means the identifying number assigned by the manufacturer or by the division for the purpose of identifying the vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(30)(b): "Identification number" includes a vehicle identification number, state assigned identification number, hull identification number, and motor serial number.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(31): "Implement of husbandry" means a vehicle designed or adapted and used exclusively for an agricultural operation and only incidentally operated or moved upon the highways.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(32): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(32)(a): "In-state miles" means the total number of miles operated in this state during the preceding year by fleet power units.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(32)(b): If a fleet is composed entirely of trailers or semitrailers, "in-state miles" means the total number of miles that those vehicles were towed on Utah highways during the preceding year.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(33): "Interstate vehicle" means a commercial vehicle operated in more than one state, province, territory, or possession of the United States or foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(34): "Jurisdiction" means a state, district, province, political subdivision, territory, or possession of the United States or any foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(35): "Lienholder" means a person with a security interest in particular property.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(36): "Manufactured home" means a transportable factory built housing unit constructed on or after June 15, 1976, according to the Federal Home Construction and Safety Standards Act of 1974 (HUD Code), in one or more sections, which, in the traveling mode, is eight body feet or more in width or 40 body feet or more in length, or when erected on site, is 400 or more square feet, and which is built on a permanent chassis and designed to be used as a dwelling with or without a permanent foundation when connected to the required utilities, and includes the plumbing, heating, air-conditioning, and electrical systems.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(37): "Manufacturer" means a person engaged in the business of constructing, manufacturing, assembling, producing, or importing new or unused vehicles, vessels, or outboard motors for the purpose of sale or trade.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(38): "Military vehicle" means a vehicle of any size or weight that was manufactured for use by armed forces and that is maintained in a condition that represents the vehicle's military design and markings regardless of current ownership or use.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(39): "Mobile home" means a transportable factory built housing unit built prior to June 15, 1976, in accordance with a state mobile home code which existed prior to the Federal Manufactured Housing and Safety Standards Act (HUD Code).
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(40): 59-13-102 "Motor fuel" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(41): 41-6a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(41)(a): "Motor vehicle" means a self-propelled vehicle intended primarily for use and operation on the highways.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(41)(b): 41-6a-102 "Motor vehicle" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(41)(b)(i): an off-highway vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(41)(b)(ii): 41-6a-102 a motor assisted scooter as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(42): 73-18-2 "Motorboat" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(43): "Motorcycle" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(43)(a): a motor vehicle having a saddle for the use of the rider and designed to travel on not more than three wheels in contact with the ground; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(43)(b): an autocycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(44): "Natural gas" means a fuel of which the primary constituent is methane.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(45): 41-1a-202
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(45)(a): 41-1a-202 "Nonresident" means a person who is not a resident of this state as defined by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(45)(b): A person who engages in intrastate business within this state and operates in that business any motor vehicle, trailer, or semitrailer in this state or who, even though engaging in interstate commerce, maintains a vehicle in this state as the home station of that vehicle is considered a resident of this state, insofar as that vehicle is concerned in administering this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(46): "Odometer" means a device for measuring and recording the actual distance a vehicle travels while in operation, but does not include any auxiliary odometer designed to be periodically reset.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(47): 41-22-2 "Off-highway implement of husbandry" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(48): 41-22-2 "Off-highway vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49): 41-26-102.1
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49)(a): 41-26-102.1 "Operate" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49)(a)(i): to navigate a vessel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49)(a)(ii): 41-26-102.1 collectively, the activities performed in order to perform the entire dynamic driving task for a given motor vehicle by:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49)(a)(ii)(A): 41-26-102.1 a human driver as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49)(a)(ii)(B): an engaged automated driving system.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(49)(b): "Operate" includes testing of an automated driving system.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(50): "Outboard motor" means a detachable self-contained propulsion unit, excluding fuel supply, used to propel a vessel.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(51): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(51)(a): "Owner" means a person, other than a lienholder, holding title to a vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor whether or not the vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor is subject to a security interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(51)(b): If a vehicle is the subject of an agreement for the conditional sale or installment sale or mortgage of the vehicle with the right of purchase upon performance of the conditions stated in the agreement and with an immediate right of possession vested in the conditional vendee or mortgagor, or if the vehicle is the subject of a security agreement, then the conditional vendee, mortgagor, or debtor is considered the owner for the purposes of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(51)(c): If a vehicle is the subject of an agreement to lease, the lessor is considered the owner until the lessee exercises the lessee's option to purchase the vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(52): "Park model recreational vehicle" means a unit that:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(52)(a): is designed and marketed as temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(52)(b): is not permanently affixed to real property for use as a permanent dwelling;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(52)(c): requires a special highway movement permit for transit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(52)(d): is built on a single chassis mounted on wheels with a gross trailer area not exceeding 400 square feet in the setup mode.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(53): "Personalized license plate" means a license plate that has displayed on it a combination of letters, numbers, or both as requested by the owner of the vehicle and assigned to the vehicle by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(54): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(54)(a): "Pickup truck" means a two-axle motor vehicle with motive power manufactured, remanufactured, or materially altered to provide an open cargo area.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(54)(b): "Pickup truck" includes a motor vehicle with the open cargo area covered with a camper, camper shell, tarp, removable top, or similar structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(55): "Plug-in hybrid electric motor vehicle" means a hybrid electric motor vehicle that has the capability to charge the battery or batteries used for vehicle propulsion from an off-vehicle electric source, such that the off-vehicle source cannot be connected to the vehicle while the vehicle is in motion.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(56): "Pneumatic tire" means a tire in which compressed air is designed to support the load.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(57): "Preceding year" means a period of 12 consecutive months fixed by the division that is within 16 months immediately preceding the commencement of the registration or license year in which proportional registration is sought.  The division in fixing the period shall conform it to the terms, conditions, and requirements of any applicable agreement or arrangement for the proportional registration of vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(58): "Public garage" means a building or other place where vehicles or vessels are kept and stored and where a charge is made for the storage and keeping of vehicles and vessels.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(59): 41-1a-503 "Receipt of surrender of ownership documents" means the receipt of surrender of ownership documents described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(60): "Reconstructed vehicle" means a vehicle of a type required to be registered in this state that is materially altered from its original construction by the removal, addition, or substitution of essential parts, new or used.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(61): 13-14-102 "Recreational vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(62): "Registration" means a document issued by a jurisdiction that allows operation of a vehicle or vessel on the highways or waters of this state for the time period for which the registration is valid and that is evidence of compliance with the registration requirements of the jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(63): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(63)(a): "Registration year" means a 12 consecutive month period commencing with the completion of the applicable registration criteria.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(63)(b): For administration of a multistate agreement for proportional registration the division may prescribe a different 12-month period.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(64): "Repair or replacement" means the restoration of vehicles, vessels, or outboard motors to a sound working condition by substituting any inoperative part of the vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor, or by correcting the inoperative part.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(65): 41-21-1(3)(a)(i)(B); 41-6a-1507(1)(a)(i)(B) "Replica vehicle" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(65)(a): 41-21-1(3)(a)(i)(B) a street rod that meets the requirements under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(65)(b): 41-6a-1507(1)(a)(i)(B) a custom vehicle that meets the requirements under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(66): "Restored-modified vehicle" means a motor vehicle that has been restored and modified with modern parts and technology, including emission control technology and an on-board diagnostic system.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(67): "Road tractor" means a motor vehicle designed and used for drawing other vehicles and constructed so it does not carry any load either independently or any part of the weight of a vehicle or load that is drawn.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(68): 73-18-2 "Sailboat" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(69): "Security interest" means an interest that is reserved or created by a security agreement to secure the payment or performance of an obligation and that is valid against third parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(70): "Semitrailer" means a vehicle without motive power designed for carrying persons or property and for being drawn by a motor vehicle and constructed so that some part of its weight and its load rests or is carried by another vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(71): 41-1a-418 "Special group license plate" means a type of license plate designed for a particular group of people or a license plate authorized and issued by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72): (72)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(a): "Special interest vehicle" means a vehicle used for general transportation purposes and that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(a)(i): 20 years or older from the current year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(a)(ii): a make or model of motor vehicle recognized by the division director as having unique interest or historic value.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(b): (72)(a) In making a determination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(b)(i): a make of motor vehicle that is no longer manufactured;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(b)(ii): a make or model of motor vehicle produced in limited or token quantities;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(b)(iii): a make or model of motor vehicle produced as an experimental vehicle or one designed exclusively for educational purposes or museum display; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(72)(b)(iv): a motor vehicle of any age or make that has not been substantially altered or modified from original specifications of the manufacturer and because of its significance is being collected, preserved, restored, maintained, or operated by a collector or hobbyist as a leisure pursuit.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73): 72-9-102
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(a): "Special mobile equipment" means a vehicle:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(a)(i): not designed or used primarily for the transportation of persons or property;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(a)(ii): not designed to operate in traffic; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(a)(iii): only incidentally operated or moved over the highways.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(b): "Special mobile equipment" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(b)(i): farm tractors;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(b)(ii): off-road motorized construction or maintenance equipment including backhoes, bulldozers, compactors, graders, loaders, road rollers, tractors, and trenchers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(b)(iii): ditch-digging apparatus.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(73)(c): 72-9-102 "Special mobile equipment" does not include a commercial vehicle as defined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(74): "Specially constructed vehicle" means a vehicle of a type required to be registered in this state, not originally constructed under a distinctive name, make, model, or type by a generally recognized manufacturer of vehicles, and not materially altered from its original construction.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(75): 41-1a-1101(5) "State impound yard" means a yard for the storage of a vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor that meets the requirements of rules made by the commission pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(76): "Title" means the right to or ownership of a vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(77): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(77)(a): "Total fleet miles" means the total number of miles operated in all jurisdictions during the preceding year by power units.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(77)(b): If fleets are composed entirely of trailers or semitrailers, "total fleet miles" means the number of miles that those vehicles were towed on the highways of all jurisdictions during the preceding year.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(78): 72-9-102 "Tow truck motor carrier" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(79): 72-9-102 "Tow truck operator" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(80): "Trailer" means a vehicle without motive power designed for carrying persons or property and for being drawn by a motor vehicle and constructed so that no part of its weight rests upon the towing vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(81): "Transferee" means a person to whom the ownership of property is conveyed by sale, gift, or any other means except by the creation of a security interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(82): "Transferor" means a person who transfers the person's ownership in property by sale, gift, or any other means except by creation of a security interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(83): "Travel trailer," "camping trailer," or "fifth wheel trailer" means a portable vehicle without motive power, designed as a temporary dwelling for travel, recreational, or vacation use that does not require a special highway movement permit when drawn by a self-propelled motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(84): "Truck tractor" means a motor vehicle designed and used primarily for drawing other vehicles and not constructed to carry a load other than a part of the weight of the vehicle and load that is drawn.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(85): "Vehicle" includes a motor vehicle, trailer, semitrailer, off-highway vehicle, camper, park model recreational vehicle, manufactured home, and mobile home.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(86): 73-18-2 "Vessel" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(87): 41-21-1 "Vintage vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(88): 73-18-2 "Waters of this state" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-102(89): "Weighmaster" means a person, association of persons, or corporation permitted to weigh vehicles under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-103 Commission to administer chapter.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall administer and enforce this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104 Commission powers.
--------------------------------------------------
The commission may:Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(1): enter into agreements with other jurisdictions:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(1)(a): relating to proportional registration to facilitate administration;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(1)(b): for the exchange of information for audit and enforcement activities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(1)(c): for cooperation with other jurisdictions;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(2): confer and advise with the proper officers, officials, and legislative bodies of other jurisdictions to promote agreements under which the registration of vehicles owned in this state is recognized by the other jurisdictions;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(3): make and enforce rules necessary to effectuate this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-104(4): adopt an official seal for the use of the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-105 Commission to create forms.
-----------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall prescribe and provide suitable forms of applications, certificates of title, registration cards, and all other forms necessary to carry out the provisions of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-106 Division created.
-------------------------------------------------
There is created within the commission the Motor Vehicle Division with the duties and powers provided in Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-107 Commission, division, and officers to enforce chapter -- Duties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission and the officers and inspectors of the division designated by the commission, peace officers, and others authorized by the division or by law shall:Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-107(1): enforce the provisions of this chapter and of all other laws regulating the registration of motor vehicles, trailers, or semitrailers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-107(2): inspect any motor vehicle, trailer, or semitrailer of a type required to be registered in any public garage or repair shop or in any place where the motor vehicle, trailer, or semitrailer is held for sale or wrecking, for the purpose of locating and investigating the title and registration of stolen motor vehicles, trailers, and semitrailers.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108 Division inspection of applications for registration, certificate of title, or license plate.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(1): The division shall examine and determine the genuineness, regularity, and legality of each application for:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(1)(a): registration of a vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(1)(b): a certificate of title for a vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(1)(c): license plates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(1)(d): any other request lawfully made to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(2): The division may investigate or require additional information on any application or request necessary to implement this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-108(3): When the division is satisfied as to the genuineness, regularity, and legality of an application and that the applicant is entitled to register the vehicle and to the issuance of a certificate of title, the division shall register the vehicle, issue a certificate of title and issue license plates.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109 Grounds for division refusing registration or certificate of title.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1): The division shall refuse registration or issuance of a certificate of title or any transfer of registration upon any of the following grounds:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1)(a): the application contains any false or fraudulent statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1)(b): the applicant has failed to furnish required information or reasonable additional information requested by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1)(c): the applicant is not entitled to the issuance of a certificate of title or registration of the vehicle under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1)(d): the division has reasonable grounds to believe that the vehicle is a stolen vehicle or that the granting of registration or the issuance of a certificate of title would constitute a fraud against the rightful owner or other person having a valid lien upon the vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1)(e): the registration of the vehicle is suspended or revoked for any reason provided in the motor vehicle laws of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(1)(f): the required fees have not been paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(2): The division shall also refuse registration or any transfer of registration if the vehicle is mechanically unfit or unsafe to be operated or moved upon the highways.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(3): Title 72, Chapter 9, Motor Carrier Safety Act The division shall refuse registration or any transfer of registration of a vehicle upon notification by the Department of Transportation that the vehicle or owner is not in compliance with
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(4): 41-1a-110(2); 41-12a-303.2(2); 41-12a-804(2) The division may not register a vehicle if the registration of the vehicle is revoked under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(4)(a): 41-12a-303.2(2) of owner's or operator's security in a form allowed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(4)(b): of exemption from the owner's or operator's security requirements; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-109(4)(c): 41-12a-804(2) that the applicant was not an owner of the vehicle at the time of the alleged violation or on the day following the time limit provided after the second notice under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110 Authority of division to suspend or revoke registration, certificate of title, license plate, or permit.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110(1): (3); (4); Title 72, Chapter 9, Motor Carrier Safety Act Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110(1)(a): the division is satisfied that a registration, certificate of title, license plate, or permit was fraudulently procured or erroneously issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110(1)(b): the division determines that a registered vehicle is mechanically unfit or unsafe to be operated or moved upon the highways;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110(1)(c): a registered vehicle has been dismantled;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110(1)(d): the division determines that the required fee has not been paid and the fee is not paid upon reasonable notice and demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-110(1)(e): a registration decal, license plate, or permit is knowingly displayed upon a vehicle other than the one for which issued;

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-111 Cancellation, suspension, or revocation of registration -- Return of registration items.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the division cancels, suspends, or revokes a registration, certificate of title, license plate, or permit under this chapter, the owner or person in possession of it shall immediately return the canceled, suspended, or revoked item to the division.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-112 Authority to administer oaths.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Officers and employees of the division designated by the commission for the purpose of administering the motor vehicle laws may administer oaths and acknowledge signatures and shall do so without fee.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-113 Power to summon witnesses and take testimony -- Service of summons -- Witness fees -- Failure to appear.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-113(1): The commission and officers of the division designated by the commission may summon witnesses to give testimony under oath or to give written deposition upon any matter under the jurisdiction of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-113(2): The summons may require the production of relevant books, papers, or records.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-113(3): Every summons shall be served at least five days before the return date, either by personal service made by any person over 18 years of age or by registered mail, but return acknowledgment is required to prove the latter service.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-113(4): The fees for the attendance and travel of witnesses are the same as for witnesses before the district court.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-113(5): Failure to obey a summons served is a class C misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-114 Method of giving notice.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-114(1): If the division is required to give any notice under this chapter or other law regulating the operation of vehicles, vessels, and outboard motors, unless a different method of giving the notice is expressly prescribed, the notice shall be given either by:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-114(1)(a): personal delivery to the person to be notified; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-114(1)(b): deposit in the United States mail of the notice in an envelope with postage prepaid, addressed to the person at the address shown by the records of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-114(2): Notice by mail is complete upon the expiration of four days after deposit of the notice.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202 Definitions -- Vehicles exempt from registration -- Registration of vehicles after establishing residency.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1): (1)(b)(i); (ii); 41-26-102.1 In this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(a): "Domicile" means the place:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(a)(i): where an individual has a fixed permanent home and principal establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(a)(ii): to which the individual if absent, intends to return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(a)(iii): in which the individual and his family voluntarily reside, not for a special or temporary purpose, but with the intention of making a permanent home.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b): (1)(b)(i); (ii); 41-26-102.1
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i): "Resident" means any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A): an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A)(I): has established a domicile in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A)(II): regardless of domicile, remains in this state for an aggregate period of six months or more during any calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A)(III): engages in a trade, profession, or occupation in this state or who accepts employment in other than seasonal work in this state and who does not commute into the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A)(IV): declares himself to be a resident of this state for the purpose of obtaining a driver license or motor vehicle registration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A)(V): declares himself a resident of Utah to obtain privileges not ordinarily extended to nonresidents, including going to school, or placing children in school without paying nonresident tuition or fees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(B): any individual, partnership, limited liability company, firm, corporation, association, or other entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(B)(I): maintains a main office, branch office, or warehouse facility in this state and that bases and operates a motor vehicle in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(B)(II): operates a motor vehicle in intrastate transportation for other than seasonal work.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(ii): "Resident" does not include any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(ii)(A): a member of the military temporarily stationed in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(ii)(B): an out-of-state student, as classified by the institution of higher education, enrolled with the equivalent of seven or more quarter hours, regardless of whether the student engages in a trade, profession, or occupation in this state or accepts employment in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(ii)(C): an individual domiciled in another state or a foreign country that:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(ii)(C)(I): is engaged in public, charitable, educational, or religious services for a government agency or an organization that qualifies for tax-exempt status under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3);

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(ii)(C)(III): is temporarily in Utah for a period not to exceed 24 months.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(2): 41-22-3; 41-22-10.3(1); (3); 41-22-5.5(3); (5); 41-6a-102; 41-6a-102; 41-6a-102; (2)(a)(iii)

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(A)(V): declares himself a resident of Utah to obtain privileges not ordinarily extended to nonresidents, including going to school, or placing children in school without paying nonresident tuition or fees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-202(1)(b)(i)(B): any individual, partnership, limited liability company, firm, corporation, association, or other entity that:

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5 Six-month registration.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(1)(a): Subject to the requirements of this section, a person may register a motorcycle or motor vehicle of 12,000 pounds or less gross laden weight for a six-month period that begins on the first day of the calendar month of registration and expires on the last day of the sixth month of registration.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(1)(b): If the last day of the registration period falls on a day in which the appropriate state or county offices are not open for business, the registration of the vehicle is extended to midnight of the next business day.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(2): A registration under this section is subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(3): (3)(a) The option to register a motorcycle or motor vehicle under this section shall be available to a person when the division:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(3)(a): has implemented the division's GenTax system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(3)(b): (3)(a) at least 30 days before implementing the division's GenTax system as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(3)(b)(i): the date the commission will implement the GenTax system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-215.5(3)(b)(ii): that, at the time the commission implements the GenTax system, the option to register a motorcycle or motor vehicle for a six-month registration period will be available.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-218 Notice of change of address.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-218(1): If a person after making application for or obtaining a vehicle registration  moves from the address named in the application, the person shall within 10 days of moving notify the division of his old and new addresses.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-218(2): A violation of this section is an infraction.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-219 Change of name -- New registration.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-219(1): If the name of any person who has applied for or obtained the registration of a vehicle is changed  the person shall surrender the last registration card and file an application for a new registration card.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-219(2): The division upon receipt of the required fees shall issue a new registration card.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-220 Lost or damaged registration card.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-220(1): If a registration card is lost, mutilated, or becomes illegible the owner of the vehicle for which the registration card was issued, as shown by the records of the division, shall immediately:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-220(1)(a): apply for a duplicate;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-220(1)(b): furnish the information satisfactory to the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-220(1)(c): pay the proper fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-220(2): A violation of this section is an infraction.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222 Application for multiyear registration -- Payment of taxes -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1): The owner of any intrastate fleet of commercial vehicles which is based in the state may apply to the commission for registration in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1)(a): The application shall be made on a form prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1)(b): Upon payment of required fees and meeting other requirements prescribed by the commission, the division shall issue, to each vehicle for which application has been made, a multiyear license plate and registration card.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1)(b)(i): The license plate decal and the registration card shall bear an expiration date fixed by the division and are valid until ownership of the vehicle to which they are issued is transferred by the applicant or until the expiration date, whichever comes first.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1)(b)(ii): An annual renewal application must be made by the owner if registration identification has been issued on an annual installment fee basis and the required fees must be paid on an annual basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1)(b)(iii): License plates and registration cards issued pursuant to this section are valid for an eight-year period, commencing with the year of initial application in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(1)(c): When application for registration or renewal is made on an installment payment basis, the applicant shall submit acceptable evidence of a surety bond in a form, and with a surety, approved by the commission and in an amount equal to the total annual fees required for all vehicles registered to the applicant in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-222(2): Each vehicle registered as part of a fleet of commercial vehicles must be titled in the name of the fleet.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-228 Special lifetime trailer registration -- Property tax or in lieu fees.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-228(1): The owner of a trailer or semitrailer used as a commercial vehicle may obtain an alternative special registration and license plate valid for the life of the trailer while the trailer is possessed by the registrant.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-228(2): The owner must file, on or before January 31 of each year after the year of issuance of the special registration and license plate, a certificate from the assessing authority to the effect that any property tax or in lieu fee due for the current year has been paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-228(3): If property tax or the in lieu fee is not paid, registration is suspended or revoked.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-229 Display of gross laden weight.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-229(1): Each vehicle registered by gross laden weight and exceeding 12,000 pounds of gross laden weight shall have the gross laden weight for which it is registered painted, stenciled, or shown by decal upon both the left and right sides of the vehicle, in a conspicuous place, in letters of a reasonable size as determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-229(2): If vehicles are registered in combination, the gross laden weight for which the combination of vehicles is registered shall be displayed upon the power unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-229(3): An owner or operator of a vehicle or combination of vehicles may not display a gross laden weight other than that shown on the certificate of registration of the vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-229(4): A park model recreational vehicle is exempt from this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-229(5): A violation of this section is an infraction.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-230 Registration checkoff for vision screening.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-230(1): A person who applies for a motor vehicle registration or registration renewal may designate a voluntary contribution for vision screening of $2.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-230(2): This contribution shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-230(2)(a): collected by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-230(2)(b): treated as a voluntary contribution to Friends For Sight to provide blindness prevention education, screening, and treatment and not as a motor vehicle registration fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-230(2)(c): transferred to Friends For Sight at least monthly, less actual administrative costs associated with collecting and transferring the contributions.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-301 Apportioned registration and licensing of interstate vehicles.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-301(1): For purposes of this section, "registrant" means an owner or operator of one or more commercial vehicles operating in two or more jurisdictions applying for apportioned registration and licensing of a commercial vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-301(2)(a): An owner or operator of a fleet of commercial vehicles based in this state and operating in two or more jurisdictions may register commercial vehicles for operation under the International Registration Plan or the Uniform Vehicle Registration Proration and Reciprocity Agreement by filing an application with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-301(2)(b): The application shall include information that identifies the vehicle owner, the vehicle, the miles traveled in each jurisdiction, and other information pertinent to the registration of apportioned vehicles.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-303 Cooperation for electronic credentialing.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall cooperate with the Department of Transportation and federal agencies to assist in providing electronic credentialing of motor carriers to facilitate implementation, compliance, and enforcement of vehicle registration, special fuel tax payment, and other registration or taxation provisions including the provisions of the International Registration Plan and the International Fuel Tax Agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-403 Plates to be legible from 100 feet.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-403(1): License plates and the required letters and numerals on them, except the decals and the slogan, shall be of sufficient size to be plainly readable from a distance of 100 feet during daylight.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-403(2): (1) An individual may not attach a tinted or translucent license plate cover that obscures the readability of the license plate as required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-403(3): A violation of this section is an infraction.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404 Location and position of plates -- Visibility of plates -- Exceptions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(1): License plates issued for a vehicle other than a motorcycle, trailer, vintage vehicle, or semitrailer shall be attached to the vehicle, one in the front and the other in the rear.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(2)(a): The license plate issued for a motorcycle, trailer, or semitrailer shall be attached to the rear of the motorcycle, trailer, or semitrailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(2)(b)(i): An owner of a vintage vehicle shall ensure that a license plate is attached to the rear of the vintage vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(2)(b)(ii): An owner of a vintage vehicle is not required to display a license plate on the front of the vintage vehicle.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(3)(a)(i): in a horizontal position to the vehicle for which it is issued to prevent the plate from swinging;

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(3)(a)(iii): in a place and position to be clearly visible; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(3)(b): maintained:

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(3)(b)(ii): in a condition to be clearly legible.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(5)(a): to a license plate that is obscured exclusively by one or more of the following devices or by the cargo the device is carrying, if the device is installed according to manufacturer specifications or generally accepted installation practices:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-404(5)(a)(i): a trailer hitch;

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-412 Design of personalized plates.
--------------------------------------------------------------
The personalized license plates shall be the same color and design as regular license plates designed for the type of vehicle being licensed and shall consist of numbers, letters, or any combination as fixed by the division, provided that there are no conflicts with existing or anticipated license plate series.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-413 Personalized plates -- Sale of vehicle -- Transfer of plates -- Release of priority.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as provided in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 41-1a-413(1): apply to display the license plates on a different vehicle owned by the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-413(2): surrender the license plates to the division and release his priority to the letters and numbers displayed on the personalized license plates.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414 Parking privileges for persons with disabilities.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1): 41-1a-420; 41-1a-420 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(a): "Accessible parking space" means a parking space that is clearly identified as reserved for use by a person with a disability and includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(a)(i): vertical signage, including the international symbol of accessibility, that is visible from a passing vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(a)(ii): a clearly marked access aisle, if provided, that is adjacent to and considered part of the parking space.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(b): 41-1a-420 "Temporary wheelchair user placard" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(c): "Van accessible parking space" means an accessible parking space that is marked for use by a qualifying person with a walking disability who has a temporary wheelchair user placard or a wheelchair user placard and includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(c)(i): vertical signage with the international symbol of accessibility and the words "van accessible" that is visible from a passing vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(c)(ii): a clearly marked access aisle that is adjacent to and considered part of the parking space.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(d): "Walking disability" means a physical disability that requires the use of a walking-assistive device or wheelchair or similar low-powered motorized or mechanically propelled vehicle that is specifically designed to assist a person who has a limited or impaired ability to walk.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(1)(e): 41-1a-420 "Wheelchair user placard" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(2): 41-1a-420 Except in parking areas designated for emergency use, a person with a disability, qualifying under rules made in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3): (3)(a); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3)(a): Only those vehicles carrying a person with a disability special group license plate, temporary removable windshield placard, or removable windshield placard and transporting a qualifying person with a disability may park in an accessible parking space.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3)(b): (3)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3)(c): (3)(a) A person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3)(c)(i): the person has a walking disability and has a temporary wheelchair user placard;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3)(c)(ii): the person has a wheelchair user placard; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(3)(c)(iii): all other accessible parking spaces that are not van accessible parking spaces are occupied.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(4): This section applies to and may be enforced on public property and on private property that is used or intended for use by the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-414(5): The parking privileges granted by this section also apply to vehicles displaying a person with a disability special group license plate, temporary removable windshield placard, or removable windshield placard issued by another jurisdiction if displayed on a vehicle being used by a person with a disability.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-415 Lost or damaged license plate.
--------------------------------------------------------------
If a license plate is lost or becomes illegible, the owner of the vehicle for which the license plate was issued shall immediately apply for and obtain a replacement license plate upon the applicant furnishing information satisfactory to the division and paying the applicable fee.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420 Disability special group license plates -- Application and qualifications -- Rulemaking.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"State law prohibits persons who do not lawfully possess a disability placard or disability special group license plate from parking in an accessible parking space designated for persons with disabilities. Persons who possess a disability placard or disability special group license plate are discouraged from parking in an accessible parking space designated as van accessible unless they have a temporary wheelchair user placard or a wheelchair user placard."Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1): Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(a): Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act "Advanced practice registered nurse" means a person licensed to practice as an advanced practice registered nurse in this state under
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(b): "Nurse practitioner" means an advanced practice registered nurse specializing as a nurse practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(c): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act "Physician" means a person licensed to practice as a physician or osteopath in this state under
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(d): Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Physician assistant" means an individual licensed to practice as a physician assistant in the state under
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(e): "Temporary wheelchair user placard" means a removable windshield placard that is issued to a qualifying person, as provided in this section, who has a walking disability that is not permanent.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(f): "Walking disability" means a physical disability that requires the use of a walking-assistive device or wheelchair or similar low-powered motorized or mechanically propelled vehicle that is designed to specifically assist a person who has a limited or impaired ability to walk.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(1)(g): "Wheelchair user placard" means a removable windshield placard that is issued to a qualifying person, as provided in this section, who has a walking disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(a): The division shall issue a disability special group license plate, a temporary removable windshield placard, or a removable windshield placard to an applicant who is either:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(a)(i): a qualifying person with a disability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(a)(ii): the registered owner of a vehicle that an organization uses primarily for the transportation of persons with disabilities that limit or impair the ability to walk.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(b): The division shall issue a temporary wheelchair user placard or a wheelchair user placard to an applicant who is either:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(b)(i): a qualifying person with a walking disability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(b)(ii): the registered owner of a vehicle that an organization uses primarily for the transportation of persons with walking disabilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(2)(c): (2)(b) The division shall require that an applicant under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(a): The person with a disability shall ensure that the initial application contains the certification of a physician, physician assistant, or nurse practitioner that:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(a)(i): the applicant meets the definition of a person with a disability that limits or impairs the ability to walk as defined in the federal Uniform System for Parking for Persons with Disabilities, 23 C.F.R. Ch. II, Subch. B, Pt. 1235.2 (1991);
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(a)(ii): if the person is applying for a temporary wheelchair user placard or a wheelchair user placard, the applicant has a walking disability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(a)(iii): specifies the period of time that the physician, physician assistant, or nurse practitioner determines the applicant will have the disability, not to exceed six months in the case of a temporary disability or a temporary walking disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(b): The division shall issue a disability special group license plate, a removable windshield placard, or a wheelchair user placard, as applicable, to a person with a permanent disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(c): The issuance of a person with a disability special group license plate does not preclude the issuance to the same applicant of a removable windshield placard or wheelchair user placard.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(d)(i): On request of an applicant with a disability special group license plate, a temporary removable windshield placard, or a removable windshield placard, the division shall issue one additional placard.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(d)(ii): On request of a qualified applicant with a disability special group license plate, the division shall issue up to two temporary wheelchair user placards or two wheelchair user placards.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(d)(iii): On request of a qualified applicant with a temporary wheelchair user placard or a wheelchair user placard, the division shall issue one additional placard.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(e): The division shall ensure that a temporary wheelchair user placard and a wheelchair user placard have the following visible features:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(e)(i): a large "W" next to the internationally recognized disabled persons symbol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(e)(ii): the words "Wheelchair User" printed on a portion of the placard.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(f): A disability special group license plate, temporary removable windshield placard, or removable windshield placard may be used to allow one motorcycle to share a parking space reserved for persons with a disability if:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(f)(i): the person with a disability:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(f)(i)(A): is using a motorcycle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(f)(i)(B): displays on the motorcycle a disability special group license plate, temporary removable windshield placard, or a removable windshield placard;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(f)(ii): the person who shares the parking space assists the person with a disability with the parking accommodation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(3)(f)(iii): the parking space is sufficient size to accommodate both motorcycles without interfering with other parking spaces or traffic movement.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(4)(a): When a vehicle is parked in a parking space reserved for persons with disabilities, a temporary removable windshield placard, a removable windshield placard, a temporary wheelchair user placard, or a wheelchair user placard shall be displayed so that the placard is visible from the front of the vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(4)(b): If a motorcycle is being used, the temporary removable windshield placard or removable windshield placard shall be displayed in plain sight on or near the handle bars of the motorcycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commission shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(a): establish qualifying criteria for persons to receive, renew, or surrender a disability special group license plate, a temporary removable windshield placard, a removable windshield placard, a temporary wheelchair user placard, or a wheelchair user placard in accordance with this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(b): establish the maximum number of numerals or characters for a disability special group license plate;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(c): require all temporary removable windshield placards, removable windshield placards, temporary wheelchair user placards, and wheelchair user placards to include:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(c)(i): an identification number;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(c)(ii): an expiration date not to exceed:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(c)(ii)(A): six months for a temporary removable windshield placard; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(c)(ii)(B): two years for a removable windshield placard; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-420(5)(c)(iii): the seal or other identifying mark of the division.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-501 Certificate of title required.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Unless exempted, each owner of a motor vehicle, vessel, outboard motor, trailer, semitrailer, manufactured home, mobile home, or off-highway vehicle shall apply to the division for a certificate of title on forms furnished by the division as evidence of ownership.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503 Certificate of title or receipt of surrender of ownership documents required -- Application by owner.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(1): 41-1a-506(1) The owner of a manufactured home or mobile home shall apply to the division for a certificate of title unless the manufactured home or mobile home is previously registered as real property under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(2)(a): An owner of a manufactured home or mobile home previously issued a certificate of title who attaches that manufactured home or mobile home to real property shall apply for a receipt of surrender of ownership documents within 45 days of attaching to the real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(2)(b): Upon application, the division shall issue a receipt of surrender of ownership documents in lieu of a certificate of title.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(2)(c): However, manufactured homes and mobile homes are not exempt from the other requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(3)(a): The owner of a manufactured home or mobile home previously issued a receipt of surrender of ownership documents who separates that manufactured home or mobile home from the real property shall apply for a certificate of title within 45 days of the separation and before any transfer of ownership of that manufactured home or mobile home.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-503(3)(b): Upon application, the division shall issue a certificate of title in lieu of a receipt of surrender of ownership documents.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-504 Exceptions to title requirements for vehicles.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each vehicle operated in this state is subject to the titling provisions of this part except:Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-504(1): special mobile equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-504(2): a vehicle owned or leased by the federal government;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-504(3): a trailer of 750 pounds or less unladen weight and not designed, used, and maintained for hire for the transportation of property or persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-504(4): modular and prebuilt homes conforming to the Uniform Building Code and presently regulated by the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development that are not constructed on a permanent chassis.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505 Exceptions to title requirements for vessels and outboard motors.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1): 73-18-9 Each vessel or outboard motor, identified by the manufacturer as a 1985 year model or newer, operated on the waters of this state  is subject to the title provisions of this part except:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(a): vessels that have valid marine documents issued by the United States Coast Guard;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(b): canoes;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(c): inflatable vessels powered by an outboard motor with a manufacturer's listed horsepower of 25 or less;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(d): outboard motors with a manufacturer's listed horsepower of 25 or less;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(e): vessels and outboard motors owned and operated by nonresidents of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(f): vessels or outboard motors owned and operated by the federal government; or
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(1)(g): 73-18-9 vessels exempt from registration under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-505(2): The division may not  provide a title on vessels and outboard motors identified by the manufacturer as a 1984 year model or older.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506 Exceptions to title requirements for manufactured homes or mobile homes.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506(1): 70D-2-401 A manufactured home or mobile home in this state is subject to the titling provisions of this part except:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506(1)(a): a manufactured home or mobile home owned and operated by the federal government; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506(1)(b): 70D-2-401 a manufactured home or mobile home that has been converted to real property under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506(2): A manufactured home or mobile home previously converted to real property but that has been separated from the real property is subject to the titling provisions of this part upon separation.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506.1 Exceptions to title requirements for park model recreational vehicles.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506.1(1): A park model recreational vehicle in this state and identified by the manufacturer as a 2015 year model or newer is subject to the titling provisions of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-506.1(2): The division may provide title to a park model recreational vehicle identified by the manufacturer as a 2014 year model or older if requested by the owner of the park model recreational vehicle.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507 Exceptions to title requirements for off-highway vehicles.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507(1): Each off-highway vehicle operated in this state and identified by the manufacturer as a 1988 year model or newer is subject to the titling provisions of this part except:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507(1)(a): off-highway vehicles owned and operated by nonresidents of  the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507(1)(b): off-highway vehicles owned and operated by the federal government; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507(1)(c): off-highway vehicles that are registered for highway use.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507(2): The division may not provide title to an off-highway vehicle identified by the manufacturer as a 1987 year model or older.


Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507.1 Exceptions to title requirements for campers.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507.1(1): Each camper in this state and identified by the manufacturer as a 2015 year model or newer is subject to the titling provisions of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-507.1(2): The division may provide title to a camper identified by the manufacturer as a 2014 year model or older if requested by the owner of the camper.

Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509 Manufacturer's certificate of origin or title.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(1): If a vehicle other than an off-highway vehicle older than a 1988 model year, or a vessel or outboard motor older than a 1985 model year has not been previously titled, the application for certificate of title shall include the manufacturer's certificate of origin properly endorsed for transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(2): The manufacturer's certificate of origin shall show:
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(2)(a): the date of sale to the dealer or person first receiving it from the manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(2)(b): the name of the dealer or person;
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(2)(c): a description sufficient to identify the vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(2)(d): a certification by the dealer that the vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor was new when sold to the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(3)(a): If the vehicle, vessel, or outboard motor is from a state or foreign country that does not issue or require certificates of title, the owner shall submit a bill of sale, sworn statement of ownership, or any other evidence of ownership required by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 41-1a-509(3)(b): The division may refuse to issue a certificate of title or receipt of surrender of ownership documents if the applicant fails to submit the evidence of ownership required.
